item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, October 19, 2024 at 4:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. New Mersenne Prime discovered (probably) (147 points | 33 comments)
2. Secret 3D scans in the French Supreme Court (618 points | 237 comments)
3. Cuba's grid goes offline with blackout after a major power plant fails (18 points | 4 comments)
4. Show HN: Go Plan9 Memo (247 points | 76 comments)
5. Doctor Fukushi Masaichi and the art of preserving tattooed skin (21 points | 3 comments)
6. setBigTimeout (138 points | 78 comments)
7. JSON Patch (198 points | 123 comments)
8. Code that helped end Apartheid (221 points | 136 comments)
9. Running an open source app: Usage, costs and community donations (174 points | 113 comments)
10. Focus on decisions, not tasks (103 points | 22 comments)
11. 4K Gaming on Raspberry Pi [through external GPU card] [video] (22 points | 3 comments)
12. Teaching old assert() new Tricks (14 points | 4 comments)
13. Where the Digital Sidewalk Ends (91 points | 51 comments)
14. Penguin Random House underscores copyright protection in AI rebuff (9 points | discuss)
15. Subvert – Collectively owned music marketplace (165 points | 83 comments)
16. The feds are coming for John Deere over the right to repair (374 points | 155 comments)
17. Ask HN: Founders, what was the major sourcing channel for your first 100 users? (97 points | 68 comments)

19. Understanding Pam and Creating a Custom Module in Python – Inside Out Insights (3 points | discuss)
20. The Making of Micro Machines (84 points | 22 comments)
21. Promising new form of antibiotic that makes bacterial cells self-destruct (6 points | discuss)
22. Why conventional wisdom on health care is wrong (a primer) (2020) (75 points | 119 comments)
23. My solar-powered and self-hosted website (134 points | 44 comments)
24. Strep A kills half a million per year; why don't we have a vaccine? (7 points | 1 comment)
25. Jury awards American Airline $9.4M from website behind 'skiplagging' hack (48 points | 56 comments)
26. Show HN: What happens if you make a crossword out of Reddit r/gaming (31 points | 43 comments)
27. Distro (YC S24) is hiring a tech lead ( | hide)
28. Microsoft and OpenAI's close partnership shows signs of fraying (278 points | 401 comments)
29. One of Florida's most lethal python hunters (96 points | 134 comments)
30. Rekhta (6 points | 1 comment)
